itemDescription: English translator, linguist, and Biblical scholar

wikipedia_page.main: Elizabeth Smith (December 1776 – 7 August 1806) was an English translator, linguist, and Biblical and Oriental scholar.

response: The poet subsequently published his wife's writings, Hinterlassene Werke von Margareta Klopstock (1759), which give evidence of a tender, sensitive and deeply religious spirit. See also Memoirs of Frederick and Margaret Klopstock (English translation by Elizabeth Smith, London, 1808) and her correspondence with Samuel Richardson, published 1818.
*Elizabeth Smith (translator) (1776–1806), English oriental scholar and translator
*Elizabeth Smith, Baroness Smith of Gilmorehill (born 1940), British peer and patron of the arts
In 1810 Bowdler edited Fragments in Prose and Verse by the late Miss Elizabeth Smith, which was very popular in religious circles.
